item.title: Report E-2024080572
item.description:
Report E-2024080572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: LIVERMORE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 20, 2024, at 1040 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Livermore, California regarding the release of f ZEP Morado Super Cleaner 20GL. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 3 gallons of ZEP Morado Super Cleaner 20GL (UN3266, Corrosive Liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) 20-gallon DF. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a 26ft x 2ft area of the trailer floor and a 12ft x 1ft area of concrete beneath the trailer. The damaged drum of residual product was placed in a 55-gallon overpack with absorbents. Contractors then neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and (1) 55-gallon DF overpack and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081497
item.description:
Report X-2024081497

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: FAIRFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/21/2024 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 9327095 at the Ground facility in Fairfield, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of four (4) 1-gallon containers packaged together in one fiberboard box. The package appeared damp on its topside. Further investigation revealed the inner containers, marked to match the label on the outside of the package, identifying the commodity as Xylenes, a fully regulated dangerous goods commodity. The shipment adorned no other markings, labeling, or paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024081407
item.description:
Report X-2024081407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: OXNARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Patrick Mier CHECKER/DRIVER REG called safety to report a HazMat spill in trailer 556479 UN2692, BORON TRIBROMIDE, 8 (6.1), PG I, POISON-INHALATION HAZARD ZONE B. Patrick stated he found the 4lbs box in the nose of the trailer and stated it looked like the box was crushed by other freight in transit . Patrick stated he was not to sure if the product was still in the container in the box or if it had leaked out in the trailer. Safety advised Patrick to stay clear of the box and the trailer until a team could arrive to assist with the spill. Patrick stated the trailer was empty and the box was on e of the last of the freight on the trailer. Patrick stated he set the box down on the table outside the trailer and will send a photo to safety. Patrick stated he does not know if anything in on the trailer floor and did not feel comfortable going back in the trailer.

item.title: Report E-2024080518
item.description:
Report E-2024080518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 7, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum was damaged and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1719-impacted drum and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024081315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: FRENCH CAMP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Notification for container HGIU 513910 was releasing at the Lathrop Yard in French Camp, CA. Contractor responded and found inadequate blocking and bracing causing a load shift. One 5-gallon pail of UN1263 released 2 gallons inside the container. GrayMar Environmental (contractor) secured the load and cleaned all impacted areas. Damaged pail was overpacked and placed back in the container.

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER AT SPACE 718 INSIDE A PACKAGE CAR IN THE PRELOAD USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ON THE BOTTOM OF THE PAIL MINOR CLEAN UP, THE PACKAGE WAS UPRIGHT PLACE THERE BY EMPLYOYEE IN THE PRELOAD, RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE,IT WAS A 5 GAL PLASTIC PAIL WITH A SMALL CRACK ON THE BOTTOM OF THE PLASTIC PAIL.

item.title: Report E-2024080488
item.description:
Report E-2024080488

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: PACOIMA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged by a skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged containers in one (1) 55-gallon drum. TWE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted waste into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.
